title: 2022 Game Jam

properties.name: description
properties.value: The 2022 Game Jam was an event during the week of 4 April 2022 where Jagex content developers developed content prototypes to workshop ideas for new content.[1] The Game Jam is meant as a replacement for Ideation time that Jagex moderators previously had. The content and ideas worked on during the Game Jam will not necessarily be added to the game or even polled.

content:
Banner made for the 2022 Game Jam

The 2022 Game Jam was an event during the week of 4 April 2022 where Jagex content developers developed content prototypes to workshop ideas for new content.[1] The Game Jam is meant as a replacement for Ideation time that Jagex moderators previously had. The content and ideas worked on during the Game Jam will not necessarily be added to the game or even polled.

Contents

  • 1 Projects
    • 1.1 Wilderness Extension
    • 1.2 The Tasakaal Trials
    • 1.3 Dog followers
    • 1.4 Other projects
  • 2 References

Projects[edit | edit source]

Wilderness Extension[edit | edit source]

An extension to the north of the Wilderness worked on by Mod Soffan,[2] Mod Ayiza,[3] Mod Roq and Mod Goblin. The extension would be entered by crossing the Bridge of Fate north of the Deserted Keep. In this area, players would be able to attack each other without combat level restrictions. Other features include a Wilderness city full of exiled Fremenniks, an ent area labelled Stokkr, a second resource area, a multi-combat revenants area, and Bounty Hunter Island. Additionally, a skull golem, a dragon, and a rat boss are located in the extended area. An extension to the Wilderness Agility Course and a new type of impling, Skull Implings, are also included in the design. Travel to the Fremennik city would be possible via an upgrade to the enchanted lyre, and travel out of the Wilderness to Rellekka would be possible via a boat found at the far north of the city.

  • A proposed map

  • A proposed dragon boss

The Tasakaal Trials[edit | edit source]

A wave-based combat minigame worked on by Mod Husky, Mod Elena, Mod Arcane, Mod Ry, Mod Halo, Mod Jerv, and Mod Brow.[4][5] After each wave the player would have to decide whether to leave the trials or continue onwards, risking all their rewards thus far as the waves get progressively more difficult. After a standard wave the player would be presented with a series of options on how to either buff the enemies or debuff the player character, further increasing the difficulty each wave. Completing a boss wave would provide a buff to the player to help carry them through the rest of the waves. Rewards would include an untradeable best-in-slot piece of equipment that would upgrade after completing each stage of the trials, a tradeable best-in-slot piece of equipment as a potential reward from each wave, and a chance for a pet based on the boss of the trial's final wave.

  • Proposed trial enemy designs

  • A mock-up of the trial's wave interface

Dog followers[edit | edit source]

Mod Skylark and Mod Oasis worked on recreating dog followers released along with Summoning in RuneScape.[6][7] Six of the dog breeds (bulldog, dalmation, greyhound, labrador, sheepdog, and terrier) were part of the unused Summoning assets in the Old School RuneScape cache. An additional five breeds (beagle, corgi, husky, pug, and Shiba Inu) and a pet version of the stray dog were also shown. For both the original and new breeds, there were two recolours along with the base models shown.

Other projects[edit | edit source]

Stam-pot bridge extends gloriously into the horizon.
  • The Garden of Death - Mod Ed[8][9]
  • Stamina Potion Bridge - Mod West, Mod Lenny[10]
  • Alternate modes for LMS - Mod Ash[11]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 3 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 3 April 2022.) Old School RuneScape: "📣 Our very first Game Jam begins on Monday! 🧠 We'll be giving the J-Mods time to focus on new and exciting ideas which means there will be no game update next week. 👁 Keep an eye on our socials throughout the next week for more Game Jam info!"
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Soffan's Twitter account. 3 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 3 April 2022.) Mod Soffan: "My Game Jam project will be a Wilderness extension. I aim to make it a friendlier place to both PvP and PvM and some of the current ideas are really promising! If you have a moment, please let me know any ideas or thoughts on how you believe Wilderness could be improved ☺️"
  3. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ayiza's Twitter account. 4 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 6 April 2022.) Mod Ayiza: "A lil something I'm helping @JagexSoffan with. Soffan has spent so much time and put in a huge amount of effort on this. Can't wait till we're able to share more of their amazing work! #OSRSgamejam"
  4. ↑ Jagex. Mod Husky's Twitter account. 5 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 6 April 2022.) Mod Husky: "Semi-mockup interface for... something! #osrsgamejam with @JagexElena @JagexArcane @JagexRy @JagexHalo"
  5. ↑ Jagex. Mod Husky's Twitter account. 8 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 8 April 2022.) Mod Husky: "So here it is! The Tasakaal Trials! This was a lot of fun to work on during the #osrsgamejam and we made some really good progress on the implementation too. Naturally it still needs to go through team validation etc. but in the meantime let us know what you think!"
  6. ↑ Jagex. Mod Skylark's Twitter account. 5 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 6 April 2022.) Mod Skylark: "Making & testing out some new dogs for the #osrsgamejam - still a WIP atm, but let me know what breeds you’d like to see in game and I’ll see how many we can get in this week! 🐶"
  7. ↑ Jagex. Mod Oasis's Twitter account. 5 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 6 April 2022.) Mod Oasis: "An adventurers best friend #osrsgamejam"
  8. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ed's Twitter account. 3 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 3 April 2022.) Mod Ed: "Our first ever Game Jam takes place next week and that can only mean one thing..."
  9. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ed's Twitter account. 8 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 8 April 2022.) Mod Ed: "The Garden of Death is a new Twisted Tale set in southern Kebos. In this quest, you find yourself exploring some hidden ruins to decipher an ancient language. Discover enough translations, and you might just uncover the fate of a long forgotten race... #osrsgamejam"
  10. ↑ Jagex. Mod West's Twitter account. 4 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 5 April 2022.) Mod West: "Game jam day #1 - Where's it going 👀 @JagexLenny #osrsgamejam" Based on a humourous Reddit post
  11. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 6 April 2022. (Archived from the original on 6 April 2022.) Mod Ash: "My project for the @OldSchoolRS GameJam - alternate modes for LMS. This is the load-out panel being updated to handle alternate builds, as a start."
rawContent:
[[File:2022 Game Jam.jpeg|thumb|300px|Banner made for the 2022 Game Jam]]
The '''2022 Game Jam''' was an event during the week of [[4 April]] [[2022]] where [[Jagex moderator|Jagex content developers]] developed content prototypes to workshop ideas for new content.{{CiteTwitter|author=Old School RuneScape|url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/1510306519862157312|date=3 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/bpc6W|archivedate=3 April 2022|quote=📣 Our very first Game Jam begins on Monday! 🧠 We'll be giving the J-Mods time to focus on new and exciting ideas which means there will be no game update next week. 👁 Keep an eye on our socials throughout the next week for more Game Jam info!}} The Game Jam is meant as a replacement for Ideation time that Jagex moderators previously had. The content and ideas worked on during the Game Jam will not necessarily be added to the game or even polled.

==Projects==
===Wilderness Extension===
An extension to the north of the [[Wilderness]] worked on by [[Mod Soffan]],{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Soffan|url=https://twitter.com/JagexSoffan/status/1510687923670294537|date=3 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/Q9q1M|archivedate=3 April 2022|quote=My Game Jam project will be a Wilderness extension. I aim to make it a friendlier place to both PvP and PvM and some of the current ideas are really promising! If you have a moment, please let me know any ideas or thoughts on how you believe Wilderness could be improved ☺️}} [[Mod Ayiza]],{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ayiza|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAyiza/status/1511054970027757574|date=4 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/gMhz1|archivedate=6 April 2022|quote=A lil something I'm helping @JagexSoffan with. Soffan has spent so much time and put in a huge amount of effort on this. Can't wait till we're able to share more of their amazing work! #OSRSgamejam}} [[Mod Roq]] and [[Mod Goblin]]. The extension would be entered by crossing the Bridge of Fate north of the [[Deserted Keep]]. In this area, players would be able to attack each other without combat level restrictions. Other features include a Wilderness city full of exiled [[Fremennik]]s, an ent area labelled Stokkr, a second resource area, a multi-combat [[revenant]]s area, and Bounty Hunter Island. Additionally, a skull golem, a dragon, and a rat boss are located in the extended area. An extension to the [[Wilderness Agility Course]] and a new type of [[impling]], Skull Implings, are also included in the design. Travel to the Fremennik city would be possible via an upgrade to the [[enchanted lyre]], and travel out of the Wilderness to [[Rellekka]] would be possible via a boat found at the far north of the city.

<gallery mode="packed" heights="150">
2022 Game Jam - Wilderness extension.jpeg|A proposed map
2022 Game Jam - Vulcu.jpeg|A proposed dragon boss
</gallery>

===The Tasakaal Trials===
A wave-based combat [[minigame]] worked on by [[Mod Husky]], [[Mod Elena]], [[Mod Arcane]], [[Mod Ry]], [[Mod Halo]], [[Mod Jerv]], and [[Mod Brow]].{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Husky|url=https://twitter.com/JagexHusky/status/1511336161020624909|date=5 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/4ezYB|archivedate=6 April 2022|quote=Semi-mockup interface for... something! #osrsgamejam with @JagexElena @JagexArcane @JagexRy @JagexHalo}}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Husky|url=https://twitter.com/JagexHusky/status/1512414385888714752|date=8 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/Nkyss|archivedate=8 April 2022|quote=So here it is! The Tasakaal Trials! This was a lot of fun to work on during the #osrsgamejam  and we made some really good progress on the implementation too. Naturally it still needs to go through team validation etc. but in the meantime let us know what you think!}} After each wave the player would have to decide whether to leave the trials or continue onwards, risking all their rewards thus far as the waves get progressively more difficult. After a standard wave the player would be presented with a series of options on how to either buff the enemies or debuff the player character, further increasing the difficulty each wave. Completing a boss wave would provide a buff to the player to help carry them through the rest of the waves. Rewards would include an untradeable best-in-slot piece of [[equipment]] that would upgrade after completing each stage of the trials, a tradeable best-in-slot piece of equipment as a potential reward from each wave, and a chance for a pet based on the boss of the trial's final wave. 

<gallery mode="packed" heights="200">
2022 Game Jam - The Tasakaal Trials - Thematics.jpeg|Proposed trial enemy designs
2022 Game Jam - The Tasakaal Trials - Interface.png|A mock-up of the trial's wave interface
</gallery>

===Dog followers===
[[Mod Skylark]] and [[Mod Oasis]] worked on recreating dog followers released along with [[Summoning]] in ''RuneScape''.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Skylark|url=https://twitter.com/jagexskylark/status/1511354286512422914|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/V3osF|archivedate=6 April 2022|date=5 April 2022|quote=Making & testing out some new dogs for the #osrsgamejam - still a WIP atm, but let me know what breeds you’d like to see in game and I’ll see how many we can get in this week! 🐶}}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Oasis|url=https://twitter.com/jagexoasis/status/1511279712907284483|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/mRRGl|archivedate=6 April 2022|date=5 April 2022|quote=An adventurers best friend #osrsgamejam}} Six of the dog breeds (bulldog, dalmation, greyhound, labrador, sheepdog, and terrier) were part of the unused Summoning assets in the [[August 2007 Archive of RuneScape|''Old School RuneScape'' cache]]. An additional five breeds (beagle, corgi, husky, pug, and Shiba Inu) and a pet version of the [[stray dog]] were also shown. For both the original and new breeds, there were two recolours along with the base models shown.

===Other projects===
[[File:2022 Game Jam - Stam-pot bridge.png|thumb|right|250px|Stam-pot bridge extends gloriously into the horizon.]]
* The Garden of Death - [[Mod Ed]]{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ed|url=https://twitter.com/JagexEd/status/1510703345836699650|date=3 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/mUBfw|archivedate=3 April 2022|quote=Our first ever Game Jam takes place next week and that can only mean one thing...}}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ed|url=https://twitter.com/JagexEd/status/1512490141947944971|date=8 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/ilrb0|archivedate=8 April 2022|quote=The Garden of Death is a new Twisted Tale set in southern Kebos. In this quest, you find yourself exploring some hidden ruins to decipher an ancient language. Discover enough translations, and you might just uncover the fate of a long forgotten race... #osrsgamejam}}
* Stamina Potion Bridge - [[Mod West]], [[Mod Lenny]]{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod West|url=https://twitter.com/JagexWest/status/1511025744872456207|date=4 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/RI8Le|archivedate=5 April 2022|quote=Game jam day #1 - Where's it going 👀 @JagexLenny #osrsgamejam|notes=Based on [https://www.reddit.com/r/2007scape/comments/9mzul5/suggestion_connect_zeah_to_the_mainland/ a humourous Reddit post]}}
* Alternate modes for LMS - [[Mod Ash]]{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1511689571091861513|date=6 April 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/2lgG2|archivedate=6 April 2022|quote=My project for the @OldSchoolRS GameJam - alternate modes for LMS. This is the load-out panel being updated to handle alternate builds, as a start.}}
